cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
what does sip stand for in the ngn / ims context
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process: In the context of Next Generation Networks (NGN) and IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS), SIP stands for Session Initiation Protocol. SIP is a signaling protocol used for initiating, maintaining, and terminating real-time sessions that involve video, voice, messaging, and other communications applications. It plays a crucial role in establishing multimedia communication sessions over the internet, making it a fundamental component in NGN and IMS architectures.

Answer: SIP stands for Session Initiation Protocol.

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
what does sip stand for in the ngn / ims context
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['SIP or sip may refer to:\n', 'The NG9-1-1 vision relies on 9-1-1 specific application functionality on an Emergency Services IP Network (ESInet) to deliver voice, video, text and data "calls" to the PSAP. The protocol used for delivering these "calls" will be the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP), or IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS, which incorporates SIP). The functional and interface standards developed by NENA describe general SIP and IMS-based architectures that allow responsible 9-1-1 Authorities flexibility in developing an infrastructure to support the envisioned features of NG9-1-1.\n', 'The IDP receives a message (IDP Message) initiated by the SSP (service switching point) and transmitted to the service control point SCP via the INAP protocol. The Service Switching Point (SSP) receives a message "(ISUP Message)" initiated by the Calling Party, this could be an IAM (Initial Address Message). The SSP evaluates the nature of the message, in the case of the IAM the called and calling party numbers. From this it determines whether it can route the call or whether it needs further instructions. In this case if the SSP does require further instructions it sends an IDP to a service control point SCP via an IN protocol. The protocol may be INAP but could be CAMEL, or bespoke INAP flavours such as Ericsson INAP, Nokia INAP, Siemens INAP\n', 'BULLET::::- Source normalized impact per paper (SNIP) – a factor released in 2012 by Elsevier based on Scopus to estimate impact. The measure is calculated as SNIP=RIP/(R/M), where RIP=raw impact per paper, R = citation potential and M = median database citation potential.\n', 'SIP was designed to provide a signaling and call setup protocol for IP-based communications supporting the call processing functions and features present in the public switched telephone network (PSTN) with a vision of supporting new multimedia applications. It has been extended for video conferencing, streaming media distribution, instant messaging, presence information, file transfer, Internet fax and online games.\n', "The abbreviation P.I.S. means piss in Danish, which should be a dead give-away about the nature of the show. The style of the show, however, convinced many people that it was a documentary, and that the abbreviation was just an unfortunate, but real, occurrence. Other Danish police and army institutions sound peculiar in Danish, when abbreviated, such as the Danish Defence Intelligence Service (da: Forsvarets Efterretningstjeneste - FE) sounding like the Danish word for fairy, or the police equivalent (PET), hence P.I.S. wasn't too far off.\n", 'SIP-I, or the Session Initiation Protocol with encapsulated ISUP, is a protocol used to create, modify, and terminate communication sessions based on ISUP using SIP and IP networks. Services using SIP-I include voice, video telephony, fax and data. SIP-I and SIP-T are two protocols with similar features, notably to allow ISUP messages to be transported over SIP networks. This preserves all of the detail available in the ISUP header, which is important as there are many country-specific variants of ISUP that have been implemented over the last 30 years, and it is not always possible to express all of the same detail using a native SIP message. SIP-I was defined by the ITU-T, whereas SIP-T was defined via the IETF RFC route.\n', 'The Soft Input Panel (also called S.I.P.) is a special on-screen input method for devices which do not have standard keyboards. SIP is commonly used in Microsoft Pocket PC and Tablet PC devices, where there is no room for a keyboard. In Microsoft Windows there is a similar on-screen keyboard used as a Microsoft Active Accessibility (MSAA) which also has an ability to change its layout according to current keyboard language and key layout. It was patented by Microsoft in November 2004 under the patent number 6819315.\n', 'In competition law, before deciding whether companies have significant market power which would justify government intervention, the test of small but significant and non-transitory increase in price (SSNIP) is used to define the relevant market in a consistent way. It is an alternative to ad hoc determination of the relevant market by arguments about product similarity.\n', 'The Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) is the signaling protocol selected by the 3rd Generation Partnership Project (3GPP) to create and control multimedia sessions with two or more participants in the IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS), and therefore is a key element in the IMS framework.\n']

Task Description:
Please extract content that may be unfamiliar to the model from these passages, 
which can provide the model with relevant background and unknown knowledge and concepts, 
helping it better understand the question. and analyze the role of these contents.

To address the question regarding what "SIP" stands for in the context of NGN (Next Generation Networks) and IMS (IP Multimedia Subsystem), we can extract and analyze relevant content from the provided passages. The key points that may be unfamiliar or require clarification include:

1. **Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)**:
   - **Definition**: SIP is a signaling protocol used for initiating, maintaining, and terminating real-time sessions that include voice, video, and messaging applications. It is essential for managing multimedia communications over IP networks.
   - **Role in NGN/IMS**: SIP is integral to the architecture of NGN and IMS, enabling the delivery of various communication services (voice, video, text, etc.) over an IP-based infrastructure. It allows for the flexibility and scalability required in modern telecommunications.

2. **IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS)**:
   - **Definition**: IMS is an architectural framework for delivering IP multimedia services. It is designed to provide a standardized way to deliver multimedia services over IP networks.
   - **Relation to SIP**: IMS incorporates SIP as its primary signaling protocol, which facilitates the establishment and control of multimedia sessions. This relationship underscores SIP's importance in the context of NGN and IMS.

3. **NG9-1-1**:
   - **Definition**: Next Generation 9-1-1 (NG9-1-1) refers to an advanced emergency response system that utilizes IP networks to deliver emergency services. It aims to enhance the capabilities of traditional 9-1-1 systems by integrating voice, video, text, and data.
   - **SIP's Role**: In the NG9-1-1 context, SIP is used to deliver emergency calls to Public Safety Answering Points (PSAPs), facilitating a more comprehensive response to emergencies.

4. **SIP Variants (SIP-I and SIP-T)**:
   - **SIP-I**: This variant encapsulates ISUP (Integrated Services Digital Network User Part) messages within SIP, allowing traditional telephony features to be maintained while transitioning to IP networks.
   - **SIP-T**: Similar to SIP-I, SIP-T is designed to transport ISUP messages over SIP networks, preserving the details of ISUP headers, which is crucial for interoperability across different national implementations.

### Analysis of the Role of These Contents:

- **Understanding SIP**: The passages clarify that SIP is not just a standalone protocol but a foundational element of modern telecommunications, particularly in the context of NGN and IMS. This understanding is crucial for grasping how contemporary communication systems operate and evolve.

- **Contextual Relevance**: By linking SIP to NG9-1-1 and IMS, the passages illustrate SIP's versatility and importance in both emergency services and general multimedia communications. This contextual relevance helps in understanding the broader implications of SIP in various applications.

- **Technical Nuances**: The mention of SIP-I and SIP-T highlights the technical complexities involved in transitioning from traditional telephony to IP-based systems. This information is vital for comprehending the challenges and solutions in integrating legacy systems with modern protocols.

In summary, the extracted content provides a comprehensive background on SIP, its role in NGN and IMS, and its significance in modern communication systems, which is essential for answering the question accurately.

knowledge enhanced inference process:
Answer:

### Knowledge Enhanced Inference Process:

In the context of Next Generation Networks (NGN) and the IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS), "SIP" stands for Session Initiation Protocol. This protocol is crucial for establishing, maintaining, and terminating real-time communication sessions that encompass various forms of media, including voice, video, and messaging. 

1. **Definition of SIP**: SIP is a signaling protocol that facilitates the initiation and management of multimedia communication sessions over IP networks. It is designed to handle the complexities of modern telecommunications, allowing for flexible and scalable communication solutions.

2. **Role in NGN and IMS**: SIP serves as a foundational element in the architecture of NGN and IMS. It enables the delivery of diverse communication services (such as voice, video, and text) over an IP-based infrastructure. This capability is essential for supporting the multimedia applications that are increasingly prevalent in today's communication landscape.

3. **Integration with NG9-1-1**: SIP also plays a significant role in Next Generation 9-1-1 (NG9-1-1) systems, which leverage IP networks to enhance emergency response capabilities. In this context, SIP is utilized to route emergency calls to Public Safety Answering Points (PSAPs), thereby improving the efficiency and effectiveness of emergency services.

4. **SIP Variants**: There are specific variants of SIP, such as SIP-I and SIP-T, which are designed to encapsulate traditional telephony signaling messages (like ISUP) within SIP. These variants ensure that essential telephony features are preserved during the transition to IP networks, addressing interoperability challenges that arise from different national implementations of telephony standards.

5. **Importance of SIP**: Understanding SIP's role is vital for comprehending how contemporary communication systems operate and evolve. Its integration into both general multimedia communications and specialized applications like NG9-1-1 illustrates its versatility and significance in modern telecommunications.

By synthesizing this knowledge, we can appreciate that SIP is not merely a technical term but a critical component that underpins the functionality and advancement of communication technologies in the NGN and IMS contexts.

### Answer:
SIP stands for Session Initiation Protocol. It is a signaling protocol used in Next Generation Networks (NGN) and the IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS) to initiate, maintain, and terminate real-time communication sessions involving voice, video, and messaging. SIP is essential for enabling multimedia communications over IP networks and plays a significant role in advanced systems like Next Generation 9-1-1 (NG9-1-1), enhancing emergency response capabilities.

**Expert Discussion on SIP in the NGN/IMS Context**

**Expert 1: The Protocol Specialist**
"I'd like to start by emphasizing that SIP stands for Session Initiation Protocol. **Expert 2: The Standards Advocate**
"I agree with the importance of SIP as outlined by Expert 1. However, I want to point out that SIP's integration into the IMS framework is particularly significant. The 3rd Generation Partnership Project (3GPP) has standardized SIP for controlling multimedia sessions, which is crucial for ensuring interoperability among various service providers. This standardization allows for a consistent approach to multimedia communications, which is vital in today's diverse telecommunications landscape."

**Expert 3: The Application Developer**
"While I appreciate the technical focus, I think it's important to consider the practical applications of SIP. The protocol's ability to support various services—like video conferencing, instant messaging, and even online gaming—demonstrates its flexibility. **Expert 5: The Historical Contextualizer**
"Building on what has been said, it's also worth noting the historical evolution of SIP. Originally designed to replicate the functionalities of the Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN), SIP has evolved to support a wide range of multimedia applications. This evolution reflects the changing landscape of communication technologies and user needs. Understanding this historical context helps us appreciate the significance of SIP in both current and future telecommunications."

**Synthesis of Insights**
The discussion reveals a consensus on the fundamental role of SIP as a signaling protocol in NGN and IMS contexts. Experts agree on its importance for establishing multimedia sessions and its adaptability to various applications, from emergency services to video conferencing. The standardization efforts by 3GPP and the integration of SIP with legacy systems through SIP-I and SIP-T protocols highlight its versatility and relevance.

Services using SIP-I include voice, video telephony, fax and data. SIP-I and SIP-T are two protocols with similar features, notably to allow ISUP messages to be transported over SIP networks. This preserves all of the detail available in the ISUP header, which is important as there are many country-specific variants of ISUP that have been implemented over the last 30 years, and it is not always possible to express all of the same detail using a native SIP message. SIP-I was defined by the ITU-T, whereas SIP-T was defined via the IETF RFC route.
', 'The Soft Input Panel (also called S.I.P.) is a special on-screen input method for devices which do not have standard keyboards. SIP is commonly used in Microsoft Pocket PC and Tablet PC devices, where there is no room for a keyboard. In Microsoft Windows there is a similar on-screen keyboard used as a Microsoft Active Accessibility (MSAA) which also has an ability to change its layout according to current keyboard language and key layout. It was patented by Microsoft in November 2004 under the patent number 6819315.
', 'In competition law, before deciding whether companies have significant market power which would justify government intervention, the test of small but significant and non-transitory increase in price (SSNIP) is used to define the relevant market in a consistent way. It is an alternative to ad hoc determination of the relevant market by arguments about product similarity.
', 'The Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) is the signaling protocol selected by the 3rd Generation Partnership Project (3GPP) to create and control multimedia sessions with two or more participants in the IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS), and therefore is a key element in the IMS framework.
']

Task Description:
Please extract content from these passages that can help enhance the model's causal reasoning and logical inference abilities.
consolidate these contents, and analyze how the selected information may impact the improvement of the model's causal reasoning and logical inference capabilities.

To enhance the model's causal reasoning and logical inference abilities, we can extract and consolidate relevant information from the provided passages regarding the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) in the context of Next Generation Networks (NGN) and IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS). Here’s a summary of the key points:

### Extracted Information:

1. **Definition of SIP**:
   - SIP stands for Session Initiation Protocol, which is a signaling protocol used to create, modify, and terminate communication sessions in an IP-based environment.

2. **Role in NGN/IMS**:
   - SIP is integral to the NG9-1-1 vision, facilitating the delivery of voice, video, text, and data calls over an Emergency Services IP Network (ESInet).
   - It is the selected signaling protocol by the 3rd Generation Partnership Project (3GPP) for controlling multimedia sessions within the IMS framework.

3. **Functionality**:
   - SIP supports various communication functions akin to those in the public switched telephone network (PSTN) and has been extended to accommodate multimedia applications, including video conferencing, instant messaging, and online gaming.

4. **Protocols Related to SIP**:
   - SIP-I (Session Initiation Protocol with encapsulated ISUP) allows ISUP messages to be transported over SIP networks, preserving detailed information critical for international communication standards.

### Analysis of Impact on Causal Reasoning and Logical Inference:

1. **Understanding Relationships**:
   - By defining SIP and its role in NGN and IMS, the model can better understand the relationships between different communication protocols and their applications. This understanding is crucial for reasoning about how changes in one protocol (e.g., SIP) can affect overall communication systems.

2. **Causal Links**:
   - The information establishes causal links between the implementation of SIP and the enhancement of multimedia communication capabilities. For instance, knowing that SIP enables video conferencing and instant messaging allows the model to infer that improvements in SIP would likely lead to better performance in these applications.

3. **Contextual Application**:
   - The context of emergency services (NG9-1-1) highlights the importance of reliable communication protocols. This can help the model reason about the implications of protocol failures or enhancements in critical situations, thereby improving its ability to assess risk and reliability in communication systems.

4. **Protocol Interactions**:
   - Understanding related protocols like SIP-I and their functions allows the model to make inferences about interoperability and the importance of maintaining detailed communication standards across different networks, which is essential for global communication.

5. **Multimedia Session Management**:
   - The model can infer that effective session management is crucial for user experience in multimedia applications. This understanding can guide reasoning about user needs and the design of future communication systems.

### Conclusion:

The extracted information about SIP in the context of NGN and IMS provides a foundational understanding of how signaling protocols operate within modern communication frameworks. By enhancing the model's knowledge of these relationships and functionalities, we can improve its causal reasoning and logical inference capabilities, enabling it to make more informed predictions and assessments regarding communication technologies and their implications.

It plays a crucial role in establishing multimedia communication sessions over the internet, making it a fundamental component in NGN and IMS architectures.

3. **Functionality**:

Fact-checking refers to the process of confirming the accuracy of a statement or claim through various sources or methods. 
This process aims to ensure that statements or claims are based on reliable and verifiable information while eliminating inaccurate or misleading content.

When a model exhibits an 'illusion' (a tendency to output deceptive data), it indicates that the training data used by the model does not necessarily support the rationality of its outputs.

what does sip stand for in the ngn / ims context

['SIP or sip may refer to:\n', 'The NG9-1-1 vision relies on 9-1-1 specific application functionality on an Emergency Services IP Network (ESInet) to deliver voice, video, text and data "calls" to the PSAP. The protocol used for delivering these "calls" will be the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP), or IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS, which incorporates SIP). The functional and interface standards developed by NENA describe general SIP and IMS-based architectures that allow responsible 9-1-1 Authorities flexibility in developing an infrastructure to support the envisioned features of NG9-1-1.\n', 'The IDP receives a message (IDP Message) initiated by the SSP (service switching point) and transmitted to the service control point SCP via the INAP protocol. The Service Switching Point (SSP) receives a message "(ISUP Message)" initiated by the Calling Party, this could be an IAM (Initial Address Message). The SSP evaluates the nature of the message, in the case of the IAM the called and calling party numbers. From this it determines whether it can route the call or whether it needs further instructions. In this case if the SSP does require further instructions it sends an IDP to a service control point SCP via an IN protocol. The protocol may be INAP but could be CAMEL, or bespoke INAP flavours such as Ericsson INAP, Nokia INAP, Siemens INAP\n', 'BULLET::::- Source normalized impact per paper (SNIP) – a factor released in 2012 by Elsevier based on Scopus to estimate impact. The measure is calculated as SNIP=RIP/(R/M), where RIP=raw impact per paper, R = citation potential and M = median database citation potential.\n', 'SIP was designed to provide a signaling and call setup protocol for IP-based communications supporting the call processing functions and features present in the public switched telephone network (PSTN) with a vision of supporting new multimedia applications. It has been extended for video conferencing, streaming media distribution, instant messaging, presence information, file transfer, Internet fax and online games.\n', "The abbreviation P.I.S. means piss in Danish, which should be a dead give-away about the nature of the show. The style of the show, however, convinced many people that it was a documentary, and that the abbreviation was just an unfortunate, but real, occurrence. Other Danish police and army institutions sound peculiar in Danish, when abbreviated, such as the Danish Defence Intelligence Service (da: Forsvarets Efterretningstjeneste - FE) sounding like the Danish word for fairy, or the police equivalent (PET), hence P.I.S. wasn't too far off.\n", 'SIP-I, or the Session Initiation Protocol with encapsulated ISUP, is a protocol used to create, modify, and terminate communication sessions based on ISUP using SIP and IP networks. Services using SIP-I include voice, video telephony, fax and data. SIP-I and SIP-T are two protocols with similar features, notably to allow ISUP messages to be transported over SIP networks. This preserves all of the detail available in the ISUP header, which is important as there are many country-specific variants of ISUP that have been implemented over the last 30 years, and it is not always possible to express all of the same detail using a native SIP message. SIP-I was defined by the ITU-T, whereas SIP-T was defined via the IETF RFC route.\n', 'The Soft Input Panel (also called S.I.P.) is a special on-screen input method for devices which do not have standard keyboards. SIP is commonly used in Microsoft Pocket PC and Tablet PC devices, where there is no room for a keyboard. In Microsoft Windows there is a similar on-screen keyboard used as a Microsoft Active Accessibility (MSAA) which also has an ability to change its layout according to current keyboard language and key layout. It was patented by Microsoft in November 2004 under the patent number 6819315.\n', 'In competition law, before deciding whether companies have significant market power which would justify government intervention, the test of small but significant and non-transitory increase in price (SSNIP) is used to define the relevant market in a consistent way. It is an alternative to ad hoc determination of the relevant market by arguments about product similarity.\n', 'The Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) is the signaling protocol selected by the 3rd Generation Partnership Project (3GPP) to create and control multimedia sessions with two or more participants in the IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS), and therefore is a key element in the IMS framework.\n']

knowledge enhanced inference process:
Answer:

**Knowledge Enhanced Inference Process:**

In the context of Next Generation Networks (NGN) and the IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS), SIP stands for Session Initiation Protocol. This protocol is essential for initiating, maintaining, and terminating real-time communication sessions that encompass various forms of media, including video, voice, and messaging. 

1. **Definition of SIP**: SIP is a signaling protocol that facilitates the setup and management of multimedia communication sessions over IP networks. It is a fundamental component of both NGN and IMS architectures.

2. **Role of SIP in NG9-1-1**: SIP is utilized in the Next Generation 9-1-1 (NG9-1-1) framework to deliver voice, video, text, and data calls to Public Safety Answering Points (PSAPs). This application highlights SIP's critical role in emergency services, showcasing its versatility beyond traditional telecommunications.

3. **SIP's Functionality**: The protocol is designed to replicate call processing functions similar to those found in the public switched telephone network (PSTN). Additionally, SIP extends its capabilities to support multimedia applications, including video conferencing, streaming media, instant messaging, and more. This evolution reflects the growing demand for integrated communication solutions.

4. **SIP-I and SIP-T**: SIP-I (Session Initiation Protocol with encapsulated ISUP) and SIP-T are protocols that enable the transport of ISUP messages over SIP networks. Understanding these protocols is vital for grasping how SIP integrates with existing telecommunications standards and facilitates interoperability.

5. **SIP's Selection by 3GPP**: The 3rd Generation Partnership Project (3GPP) has selected SIP as the signaling protocol for creating and controlling multimedia sessions within the IMS framework. This endorsement underscores SIP's significance in modern telecommunications standards and its role in enabling seamless multimedia communication.

By incorporating this detailed understanding of SIP's definition, functionality, applications, and its relevance in emergency services and telecommunications standards, the model can enhance its accuracy and reliability regarding SIP in the context of NGN and IMS. This comprehensive perspective helps mitigate the risk of model illusions and ensures factual correctness.

**Answer**: SIP stands for Session Initiation Protocol. It is a signaling protocol used in Next Generation Networks (NGN) and the IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS) to initiate, maintain, and terminate real-time communication sessions involving video, voice, and messaging. SIP plays a crucial role in various applications, including emergency services (NG9-1-1), and is integral to modern telecommunications standards as endorsed by the 3rd Generation Partnership Project (3GPP).

question_info.question: what does sip stand for in the ngn / ims context
passages:
SIP or sip may refer to:
The NG9-1-1 vision relies on 9-1-1 specific application functionality on an Emergency Services IP Network (ESInet) to deliver voice, video, text and data "calls" to the PSAP. The protocol used for delivering these "calls" will be the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP), or IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS, which incorporates SIP). The functional and interface standards developed by NENA describe general SIP and IMS-based architectures that allow responsible 9-1-1 Authorities flexibility in developing an infrastructure to support the envisioned features of NG9-1-1.
The IDP receives a message (IDP Message) initiated by the SSP (service switching point) and transmitted to the service control point SCP via the INAP protocol. The Service Switching Point (SSP) receives a message "(ISUP Message)" initiated by the Calling Party, this could be an IAM (Initial Address Message). The SSP evaluates the nature of the message, in the case of the IAM the called and calling party numbers. From this it determines whether it can route the call or whether it needs further instructions. In this case if the SSP does require further instructions it sends an IDP to a service control point SCP via an IN protocol. The protocol may be INAP but could be CAMEL, or bespoke INAP flavours such as Ericsson INAP, Nokia INAP, Siemens INAP
BULLET::::- Source normalized impact per paper (SNIP) – a factor released in 2012 by Elsevier based on Scopus to estimate impact. The measure is calculated as SNIP=RIP/(R/M), where RIP=raw impact per paper, R = citation potential and M = median database citation potential.
SIP was designed to provide a signaling and call setup protocol for IP-based communications supporting the call processing functions and features present in the public switched telephone network (PSTN) with a vision of supporting new multimedia applications. It has been extended for video conferencing, streaming media distribution, instant messaging, presence information, file transfer, Internet fax and online games.
The abbreviation P.I.S. means piss in Danish, which should be a dead give-away about the nature of the show. The style of the show, however, convinced many people that it was a documentary, and that the abbreviation was just an unfortunate, but real, occurrence. Other Danish police and army institutions sound peculiar in Danish, when abbreviated, such as the Danish Defence Intelligence Service (da: Forsvarets Efterretningstjeneste - FE) sounding like the Danish word for fairy, or the police equivalent (PET), hence P.I.S. wasn't too far off.
SIP-I, or the Session Initiation Protocol with encapsulated ISUP, is a protocol used to create, modify, and terminate communication sessions based on ISUP using SIP and IP networks. Services using SIP-I include voice, video telephony, fax and data. SIP-I and SIP-T are two protocols with similar features, notably to allow ISUP messages to be transported over SIP networks. This preserves all of the detail available in the ISUP header, which is important as there are many country-specific variants of ISUP that have been implemented over the last 30 years, and it is not always possible to express all of the same detail using a native SIP message. SIP-I was defined by the ITU-T, whereas SIP-T was defined via the IETF RFC route.
The Soft Input Panel (also called S.I.P.) is a special on-screen input method for devices which do not have standard keyboards. SIP is commonly used in Microsoft Pocket PC and Tablet PC devices, where there is no room for a keyboard. In Microsoft Windows there is a similar on-screen keyboard used as a Microsoft Active Accessibility (MSAA) which also has an ability to change its layout according to current keyboard language and key layout. It was patented by Microsoft in November 2004 under the patent number 6819315.
In competition law, before deciding whether companies have significant market power which would justify government intervention, the test of small but significant and non-transitory increase in price (SSNIP) is used to define the relevant market in a consistent way. It is an alternative to ad hoc determination of the relevant market by arguments about product similarity.
The Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) is the signaling protocol selected by the 3rd Generation Partnership Project (3GPP) to create and control multimedia sessions with two or more participants in the IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS), and therefore is a key element in the IMS framework.
